h3.a: WHAT TO DO IF YOUÂ ARE SICK?

div.p: Last updated: 03-17-20

Governor Inslee announced that all schools will continue to be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year in order to continue slowing the spread of COVID-19. As a result, all schools in the Kelso School District will remain closed through the end of the 2019-20 school year (June 19, 2020).

This continued closure is difficult for students, staff, families and the entire community. This can be particularly disappointing news for students who miss their friends and teachers and raises some additional questions about events and activities that would typically be happening at this time in our school year.

We want to reassure you that moving forward, we will continue providing educational services, and we will be answering questions about alternative plans for events and activities as we know more information. It is important to stay connected to our district websites for the most recent information
div.h3: Will our school district provide childcare?Â
div.p: We recognize that closing schools has a major impact on our communities ability to staff hospitals, health care facilities, and other fire and medical departments. The Governor has asked us to help our families who are in the medical field or who are first responders to find temporary childcare during this outbreak.

Because many school districts do not have the staff or space to offer childcare during these times, we are now being advised to direct families to the following website https://childcareawarewa.org or to call the Child Aware Family Center directly at 1-800-446-1114. The Child Aware team will help you find child care in our local area.
div.h3: Will meals be provided for students during the closure?Â
div.p: Yes. We will provide a sack breakfast and a sack lunch simultaneously Monday â€“ Friday at specific schools and community locations. We will start distribution on Thursday March 19th.Â Â Current specific site information and times are listed here.Â
div.h3: Will students be learning from home during the closure?Â
div.p: OSPI believes that for most districts, it will make more sense to cancel school altogether than to organize a learning model that cannot be accessed equitably by all students.Â Â To support families during the coronavirus outbreak, our Teaching and Learning Department has compiled a list of resources to explore during our school closure. This list will expand in the coming weeks. It was intentionally limited this first week as families adjust to the new schedule. We will continue to update resources frequently for all grade levels.
You can find these new resources on the Kelso School District COVID-19 webpage or directly by clicking here.

ul.li: These activities and resources are optional for students and are not required or graded.

div.p: Staying engaged with learning during the closure will help to minimize the loss of learning. We look forward to school reconvening and teachers will resume instructionâ€¯highlighting those standards that are most criticalâ€¯moving forward.

OSPI has decided to cancel all state testing for the 2019â€“20 school year. This includes the Smarter Balanced Assessment (SBA), the Washington Comprehensive Assessment of Science (WCAS), the Washington Access to Instruction and Measurement (WA-AIM), English Learner Progress Assessment for the 21st Century (ELPA21), and WIDA Alternate ACCESS for ELLs.
Still not sure. We await guidance from the state. We anticipate flexibility and emergency waivers of some type.
No, graduation ceremony will remain on Saturday, June 6, at 1:00 pm.
div.h3: What will staff members be doing during the closure?Â
div.p: Many staff will still be working, albeit in creative, non-traditional, and flexible ways, and they will still get paid according to information we have received from Governor Inslee and Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction.
div.h3: What about sports and other extracurricular activities?Â
div.p: Per the directive from Governor Inslee, all sports and extracurricular activities are cancelled this school year. Canceled means no students or staff will be allowed to gather for workouts, practices, or performances.Â
div.h3: Is my scheduled facility use of our schools and fields canceled?Â
div.p: Yes, all facility use by outside community members, staff, students, and groups have been canceled until further notice.
div.h3: Will Schools, the District Office, and Transportation/Maintenance be open to the public during the school closure?Â
div.p: No, all facilities will be closed to the public beginning March 16, 2020, and will remain closed until further notice.
div.h3: How will the school district communicate information with families and the community?

ul.li: Notifications via the Kelso School District app (download for free)

Kelso School District
601 Crawford St

The mission of Kelso Public Schools is to prepare every student for living, learning and achieving success as a citizen of our changing world.
Our students begin school ready to learn, transition confidently between grades and schools, and emerge from our district as engaged citizens, both career and college-ready.

Kelso School District #458 complies with all federal rules and regulations and does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups listed in Title 36 of the United States Code. The following employee(s) has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Tim Peterson, Director of Human Resources, the school districtâ€™s Title VII Officer and ADA Coordinator. People of disability may request reasonable accommodation in the hiring process by contacting, Tim Peterson, Director of Human Resources, 601 Crawford Street, Kelso, WA 98626 or (360) 501-1924.

Inquiries regarding compliance procedures regarding students may be directed to Don Iverson, Director of Student Services, the school districtâ€™s Title IX Coordinator or Holly Budge, Director of Special Programs, the school districtâ€™s Section 504 Coordinator, 601 Crawford Street, Kelso, WA 98626 (360) 501-1900.
